intro: Pentacalia albiramea, commonly known as the white-flowered pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant is herbaceous, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
